channel.title: Gielinor Heightmap Request
channel.description:
Hello there! Does anybody have Gielinor heightmap? I have been looking for it for days but can't find anything
Any kind of help would be really appreciated.

item.title: Gielinor Heightmap Request
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

right, I didn’t clarify that. I meant for locations that go “too high” it teleports you to a cloned area, not as a general rule.

Read full topic

item.title: Gielinor Heightmap Request
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Death Style, post:20, topic:546210”][quote author=Limits link=topic=665106.msg4446223#msg4446223 date=1408942858]

What do you mean?
The floors are like:
-1 - underground floor
0 - ground floor
1 - first floor
2 - second floor
3 - third floor (Repeat of floor -1)
4 - fourth floor (Repeat of floor 0)

From that point on, it’s basically repeating each floor…

According to you, the highest a building can go is 2 floors above ground. Isn’t falador castle 3 story? Like the place where you start Black Knights Fortress.
[/quote]
that’s correct (I think it’s actually 3 floors above)

when you go “too high” it teleports you to a location which is just a clone of the area, but the level 0 is now several feet higher
you can test this at the agility pyramid and I think maybe at the tower of life and that tower where you purchase mystic battlestaves
you’ll see the “loading - please wait” when you are teleported to the cloned area

there are only 4 floors IIRC, and I think the majority of the areas use 0 as the ground floor (-1 would revert to the highest floor), with some exceptions like POH where 0 is actually underground, so I’m not sure what sk8rdude’s conventions are[/quote]
There is only 4 floors, yes. But they also repeat themselves.
The content on floor 0 is on height levels: 4, 8, 12, 16, 20 etc.
The content on floor 1 is on height levels: 5, 9, 13, 17, 21, etc.
and so forth.
The content you see on height level 3 is also on height level -1, I was just throwing that in there for perspective.

Read full topic

item.title: Gielinor Heightmap Request
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

[quote=“Limits, post:15, topic:546210”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665106.msg4446157#msg4446157 date=1408917862]
What do you mean?
The floors are like:
-1 - underground floor
0 - ground floor
1 - first floor
2 - second floor
3 - third floor (Repeat of floor -1)
4 - fourth floor (Repeat of floor 0)

From that point on, it’s basically repeating each floor…
[/quote]
According to you, the highest a building can go is 2 floors above ground. Isn’t falador castle 3 story? Like the place where you start Black Knights Fortress.[/quote]
that’s correct (I think it’s actually 3 floors above)

when you go “too high” it teleports you to a location which is just a clone of the area, but the level 0 is now several feet higher
you can test this at the agility pyramid and I think maybe at the tower of life and that tower where you purchase mystic battlestaves
you’ll see the “loading - please wait” when you are teleported to the cloned area

there are only 4 floors IIRC, and I think the majority of the areas use 0 as the ground floor (-1 would revert to the highest floor), with some exceptions like POH where 0 is actually underground, so I’m not sure what sk8rdude’s conventions are

Read full topic

item.title: Gielinor Heightmap Request
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Limits, post:17, topic:546210”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665106.msg4446229#msg4446229 date=1408944973]

What do you mean?
The floors are like:
-1 - underground floor
0 - ground floor
1 - first floor
2 - second floor
3 - third floor (Repeat of floor -1)
4 - fourth floor (Repeat of floor 0)

From that point on, it’s basically repeating each floor…

According to you, the highest a building can go is 2 floors above ground. Isn’t falador castle 3 story? Like the place where you start Black Knights Fortress.

This isn’t “according to me” go try it yourself.
Go to any coords on height level 0. Then go to those same coords on height level 4, and again on height level 8.
[/quote]
I know that the fourth floor repeats the ground floor but I dont recall the 3rd floor repeating the -1 height level.[/quote]

Here’s me standing on a floor with -1 height.

Here’s me at the exact same coordinates but with 3 height. I have npcs spawned on 3 height.

Read full topic

item.title: Gielinor Heightmap Request
item.dc:creator: @Braffolk Braffolk
item.description:
@Braffolk wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:12, topic:546210”][quote author=Braffolk link=topic=665106.msg4446202#msg4446202 date=1408927205]

I don’t believe RS even uses heightmaps. I’m pretty sure that the map data is just information about chunks or regions. Your best bet is reverse engineering via something like this: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,499418.0.html a map editor for rs2. The links for uppit are down but if you look you might be able to find a reupload.

You sound like you’re coming from a 3D game development background, and I just want to point it RS2 protocol doesn’t behave like anything you’ll ever find or do in Unity or UDK.

Well, I have been messing with this thing for weeks now and without any proper place to find any sort of information about the actual data in there it’s pretty hard to try to get it working. So there is no documentation whatsoever about how the maps work, what kind of data they contain , etc?

And yes, I have been working with 3D for quite awhile but not in a pre-built engine such as unity , UDK , etc.
[/quote]
Documentation only comes as people discover what everything does, all I can tell you is that maps in RS are tile based, as to how they work, I don’t know. However people are always trying to learn about the client and do things like you’re trying to do. You should contact Ambokile, he is currently working on a refactoring project for the 317 client and may be of assistance to you.[/quote]

Ah thanks Ill try asking him for assistance.

Read full topic

item.title: Gielinor Heightmap Request
item.dc:creator: @Braffolk Braffolk
item.description:
@Braffolk wrote:

What I mean by that is a heightmap where every tile is represented by one pixel and it’s height is represented by the brightness of the colour.

A random heightmap:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heightmap

Read full topic

item.title: Gielinor Heightmap Request
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

eyeownyew:

there’s an underground floor? I thought everything underground was just somewhere else on the map

There is but isn’t.
The “underground” is a repeat of height 3.
I’ve found there are quite a bit of maps that are drawn on height level 3/-1 that represent underground, so that’s why I called it as such.
I also put -1 to make reference to me saying that the floor repeats.

Read full topic
